title.narrative: PH 2019-2021 Community-based Alternative Care for CSEC (CARE for CSEC)

description.narrative: The project is a pilot endeavor to develop a community-supported foster care program for rescued commercially sexually exploited children whose victimization entails that they be pulled-out of their family and community because the perpetrators are located therein.  It is community-supported because the project aims to develop the foster care program within a child-safe community supported by a strong partner people’s organization, barangay local government unit and Cebu City Social Welfare Office in close coordination with the Department of Social Welfare and Development.
Expenditure 2019
Expenditure 2020

comment.narrative:
No additional children profiled from Balay-Damgo in 3rd Quarter.
Cebu City DSWS initially referred three (3) children for foster care.;
One (1) male foster child in Budlaan;
There is no child matching for boy within the reporting quarter due to delayed issuance of foster care license to foster parent applicants.;
expenditure reflected in Output 1.2. also covered this output 1.1;

comment.narrative: 16 members of the newly-organized Banilad Child Protection Task Force attended (in separate schedules) the awareness regarding the Anti-trafficking in Persons Act.;
6 CPTF/CSO in Barangay Banilad;

There is underspending because the project staff maximized the one-on-one discussion about CPTF tasks and functions and discussed basic rights of children. Hence, those three (3) individuals decided to join the CPTF.;

title.narrative: Child protection committees (Child Protection Task Force) supported

description.narrative: Child protection committees (Child Protection Task Force) supported

title.narrative: # of child protection committees supported

description.narrative: # of child protection committees supported

comment.narrative: 2 CPTF formations (Banilad with 15 members and Budlaan with 17 members);
CPTF created its 2nd quarter plan during the Assessment-Planning workshop conducted last February 21, 2020 and attended by its 13 members;
During the 3rd quarter, the Banilad Child Protection Task Force was formally organized with 16 total members. They already took their oath and elected its President, Vice-president and Secretary.;
The project team conducted quarterly meeting for CPTF Budlaan and Banilad separately.;

title.narrative: Effective referral system established

description.narrative: Effective referral system established

title.narrative: # of effective referral systems established

description.narrative: # of effective referral systems established

comment.narrative: Banilad referral pathways established;

Budlaan LGU will revisit its referral mechanism/system in October 2020.
Banilad LGU will conduct workshop for establishment of referral mechanism/system in October 2020.;
On-going, to be continued after the ECQ;
The slight overspending is due to conversion loss.;

comment.narrative: 1 male foster child;

The issuance of licenses is dependent to the monthly targets of the personnel of ARRS DSWD 07.
Only 1 of the foster 4 newly-licensed parents for Q1 has a foster child. Thus, only one (1) foster parent received financial support from the project starting the month of March.;
There are only two (2) out the 24 families identified in the data baseline study were able to pass the family assessment. And five (5) out of six (6) based on a list recommended by the LGU;

title.narrative: Female community members (with children at risk of CSEC) that participated in awareness

description.narrative: Female community members (with children at risk of CSEC) that participated in awareness

description.narrative: # of female community members (with children at risk of CSEC) that participated in awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: A total of 103 female community members participated in awareness six (6) awareness sessions regarding the Anti-Trafficking in Persons Act conducted during the third quarter.;
New female 112 attended the ATIP awareness sessions;
The session in March was not realized due to Cebu City’s declaration of ECQ.;
The target numbers for female community members exceeds because most of the time women were in their homes during the conduct of awareness sessions.;

title.narrative: Government officials trained on CSEC

description.narrative: Government officials trained on CSEC

description.narrative: # of government officials trained on CSEC

comment.narrative: Government Officials 3 (Kagawad Victoria Bongo, Kagawad Avelyn Archival, Kagawad Emma Opone);

No training conducted during the 3rd quarter due but there were five (5) barangay officials (Punong Barangay Dennes Tabar, SK Chair Jessa Mae Ricarte, Kagawad Adelaida Ouano, Kagawad Teofe Butas and Kagawad Alfredo Gabini) in Banilad were present during one of our awareness sessions regarding Anti-Trafficking in Persons Act.;
The project team visited these four (4) government officials and discussed with them the situation of CSEC and provided input about the project and child rights.;

comment.narrative: A total of 28 male community members participated in awareness six (6) awareness sessions regarding the Anti-Trafficking in Persons Act conducted during the third quarter.;
New male 23 attended the ATIP awareness sessions;
The session in March was not realized due to Cebu City’s declaration of ECQ.;
The target for male community members was not achieved because most of the male members are breadwinners and not available during the awareness sessions.;

title.narrative: Meetings held with government officials

description.narrative: # of meetings held with government officials

comment.narrative:
Conducted BCPC meeting in Barangay Budlaan.
Conducted Partnership Signing with Barangay Banilad.;

Courtesy meetings with BLGU-BCPC Talamban and Banilad were conducted separately on the same day. At Banilad, six (6) members of BCPC, and two (2) barangay councilors were present and at Talamban, four (4) BCPC members, Barangay Captain, Barangay Secretary and GAD Focal were present.;
October 21 and November 19;
